body: Hi everyone. I have some questions regarding the display of the annual total solar radiation chart. The picture below is the baked geometry in Rhino. - How do you modify the position of the secondary x-and y-axes? And how do you make them invisible? - How do you change the x- and y-scale of the chart? For instance displaying every 10 degrees of azimuth? - My input surface is a hyperbolic paraboloid, facing south symmetrically. How does the component calculate its tilt and azimuth? - Is it possible to do this for multiple surfaces at the same time? For instance for a tangential tessellation of rectangular standardized solar panels on the hyperbolic paraboloid.
